posts._title: Paolo Sorrentino – La grande bellezza AKA The Great Beauty (2013)
posts.title: La grande bellezza
posts.excerpt: Synopsis The story of an aging writer who bitterly recollects his passionate, lost youth. A portrait of today’s Rome. imdb.com Reviews Rome in all its splendor and superficiality, artifice and significance, becomes an enormous banquet too rich to digest in one sitting in Paolo Sorrentino’s densely packed, often astonishing “The Great Beauty.” A tribute to, …

posts.title: Subway Riders
posts.excerpt: Subway Riders is an epic NoWave/NY noir-melodrama, in which a nocturnal saxophonist morphs into a bewitching serial killer. With transcendant performances by John Lurie, Cookie Mueller, Glenn O’ Brien, Robbie Coltrane, Bill Rice, Charli Kaleina, Emilio Cubera and Susan Tyrrell, it captures the colorful junkie landscape of downtown Manhattan in the late 70’s with fearless …

posts._title: Sergei Loznitsa – Zhizn, osin AKA Life, Autumn (1999)
posts.title: Zhizn, osin
posts.excerpt: Quote: What first appear to be photographs of elderly Russian peasants and farmers, becomes an evocative meditation on old Russia and new, a snapshot of a disappearing way of life. As they stand in their work clothes, often with tools by their side, looking into the camera, this remarkable film with poetic rigor, captures a …

posts._title: Nikita Mikhalkov – Pyat vecherov aka Five Evenings (1979)
posts.title: Pyat vecherov
posts.excerpt: Quote: Based on the play by Alexander Volodin. The set is the 1950s. The tangible world of an old communal apartment is recreated onscreen with an incredible accuracy, every thing capturing the flair of the time. The stylized visuals, the curious objects, the amusing inhabitants, so charming and exotic… There are all the marks of …

posts.title: Blokada
posts.excerpt: Icarus Films PR about the movie: The longest siege during World War II was that of Leningrad, which lasted for 900 days, from September 1941 to January 1944, when Hitler attempted to starve the Soviet city of three million people into submission. Estimates of the number of residents who died from starvation, disease or cold …

posts.title: Artel
posts.excerpt: A classic of Russian documentary film he also stamps his typical hallmark on his latest film. Long shots fragmented with fade-outs, a sophisticated composition and the effective use of 35 mm black-and-white film. Loznitsa is able to raise seeming banality to the status of an artistic testimony indirectly reminiscent of the classics of Russian cinematography. …

posts.title: Nairobi Half Life
posts.excerpt: * The official submission of Kenya to the Best Foreign Language Film of the 85th Academy Awards 2013. Despite his parents’ wishes, Mwas leaves his small village and embarks on a journey to Kenya’s capital in order to pursue a career in acting. Naïve and filled with hope, he quickly learns why the city is …

posts._title: Jane Arden – The Other Side of the Underneath [Workprint Version] (1972)
posts.title: The Other Side of the Underneath [Workprint Version]
posts.excerpt: Quote: Jane Arden’s The Other Side of the Underneath is a seriously disturbing film. It is also an uncharacteristically bold one. I think that in a lot of ways it is quite similar to Bernardo Bertollucci’s Partner (1968), a film about a young revolutionary, played by Pierre Clementi, whose life changes dramatically when a double …

posts._title: Aleksandr Sokurov – Dukhovnye golosa. Iz dnevnikov voyny. Povestvovanie v pyati chastyakh aka Spiritual Voices (1995)
posts.title: Dukhovnye golosa Iz dnevnikov voyny Povestvovanie v pyati chastyakh
posts.excerpt: Quote: The film develops as the author’s diary, where unbiased narration is dissolved in the lyrical intonation. You watch the real persons in the particular circumstances on the screen. They are Russian frontier–guards on the Tadjik–Afghani border. But it is also a piece of art, where aesthetic laws give the theme and arrange the facts …

posts._title: Mario Monicelli – L’armata Brancaleone aka For love and for gold (1966)
posts.title: L’armata Brancaleone
posts.excerpt: A group of rogues steal a scroll granting its bearer the property of the land of Aurocastro in Apulia (south of Italy). They elect a shaggy knight, Brancaleone from Norcia, as their leader, and decide to get possession of this supposedly wealthy land. Many adventures will occurr during the journey.
